ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Timepoint/visit label
Type of Assessment
Trial counter
Notes: where 'trial' is the fading-in of an image and associated user's response (int)

ElementDescription: Type of trial
Image file displayed on screen
Time it took the image to fade-in (ms)
Whether this trial required the user to emit a response (go = 1) or abstain (go = 0) (boolean)
Trial reaction time (ms)
Response classification
Notes: 0 = no response to go trial (omission error); 1 = go response to go trial, or no response to no-go trial (correct response); -1 = go response to no-go trial (commission error)

ElementDescription: Image visibility at the time of response
Type of response
Notes: 0 = omission or correct withdrawal of response; 1 = late response to a previous trial; 2 = response within the current trial

ElementDescription: Classification rule used to assign a user's response to a trial
Event triggered by the response
Notes: 1= NA, no response; 2= keydown, keyboard keypress; 3= touchstart/pointerdown-touch, touchscreen touch; 4= pointerdown-mouse, mouse click

ElementDescription: Proportion of correct responses for all test trials
Average reaction time of correct responses to all test trials (ms)
Median reaction time of correct responses to all test trials (ms)
Standard deviation of reaction times of correct responses to test trials (ms)
Coefficient of variation of reaction times of correct responses to test trials
Proportion of commission errors (go responses to no-go trials)
Proportion of omission errors (no-go responses to go trials)
User's sensitivity, computed as follows:
Notes: pHit = 1 - CEprop (subtract 0.5 error if CE = 0); pFA = OEprop (add 0.5 error if OE = 0); d' = norminv(pHit) - norminv(pFA)

ElementDescription: User's bias, computed as follows:
User's performance score, computed as follows:
User's response device
Test's script version
